summary: This is an email from Mark Epstein to Stacey Richman, forwarded by Mark Slilin, discussing injuries found on Jeffrey Epstein's body. It argues that abrasions above the noose line and bruises on the wrists and arms are inconsistent with death by hanging.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Sends an email to Stacey Richman analyzing injuries on Jeffrey Epstein's body, arguing they are inconsistent with death by hanging.

persons.name: Stacey Richman
persons.context: Receives an email from Mark Epstein discussing the forensic analysis of Jeffrey Epstein's injuries.

persons.name: Mark Slilin
persons.context: Forwards an email from Mark Epstein to another recipient, with the subject line referencing 'JE4' (likely Jeffrey Epstein).

connections.description: Mark Epstein sends an email to Stacey Richman containing forensic analysis regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Mark Slilin forwards an email originally sent by Mark Epstein.

events.title: Email discussing Epstein's injuries
events.description: Mark Epstein sends an email to Stacey Richman analyzing injuries on Jeffrey Epstein's body, contesting the official hanging narrative.

keyFacts: The email discusses forensic details of Jeffrey Epstein's death, specifically abrasions and bruises.
It argues that abrasions found above the noose line are inconsistent with death by hanging, as hanging would cause abrasions below the noose line.
It notes the presence of wrist and arm bruises on Epstein's body.
The correspondence suggests skepticism or an alternative theory regarding the official cause of Jeffrey Epstein's death.
